sense.gloss: niche for a Buddhist image, alcove
miniature shrine for a Buddhist image
portable shrine used to move a deceased person from their house to the graveyard (in Okinawa)
rotating stage machinery, which rolls backwards 90 degrees to reveal the next scene
ceremonial removal of the coffin from the house (lay person) or temple (priest) (Zen Buddhism)
Buddha figure carved into a rock
place to store a body in a coffin before burial (Okinawa)
flashlight-like lantern with a freely rotating candle that only directs light forward
